name: Chamberlain West Hollywood

reviews.text: Staying at The Chamberlain in West Hollywood is always a fantastic experience visit LA three times a year to shop, and visit local stores.
reviews.title: Shopping and MORE Shopping

reviews.text: The hotel is tucked away on a residential street in West Hollywood, and is perfect for relaxing after shopping the different areas of hectic LA during the week. It's situated off a main thoroughfare, making it easy to access both the highway and surface streets.
reviews.title: Great Boutique Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel has a great staff, who often go above and beyond to ensure that my stay is perfect.
reviews.title: The Chamberlain, West Hollywood

reviews.text: The staff are able and willing to make restaurant recommendations, and help me acquire the odds and ends I need to work remotely for the week- and still have a pleasurable experience.
reviews.title: Not even a 3 star hotel!

reviews.text: I used to wake up early, leave the hotel, and walk up Alta Loma to get a decent workout at the Equinox off Sunset. But the recent gym renovations save me $35/day in guest passes, thanks to the equipment upgrade.
reviews.title: Great location; not so great accomodation

reviews.text: We stayed here from 9/9/12 - 9/16/12 and had a lovely time. The staff were very friendly and welcoming, and assisted us well whenever we asked questions about the area. Rooms are lovely and spacious, with frequent maid service and an attentive engineer who helped with our broken lamp.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel, friendly staff.

reviews.text: Our balcony didn't offer much of a view unfortunately, but was only a minor issue as we didn't spend long in the room. My only criticism would be the added tax that was put on the bill when we checked out. I encourage future guests to be aware of this, as an additional $40 per night tax addition impacted on my budget for the remainder of our trip, and I didn't feel I was made fully aware that this would be an additional fee upon checkout of the hotel. Most hotels would include this on the booking confirmation when first making a reservation.
reviews.title: Always reliable. Big rooms. Great customer service.

reviews.text: With that being said, we very much enjoyed our stay at the hotel and wouldn't hesitate in coming back in the future.
reviews.title: Great quiet location in WEHO close to all the action

reviews.text: I have been staying at the Chamberlain for years and have always considered it to be my little secret in the city. This city can be quite a scene and the Chamberlain is calm, classy and unpretentious.
reviews.title: Fee-gauging trumps the attempted upscale feel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are larger than most and recently updated. There is a spacious desk and work area in the rooms which make it great for business travel. Only some of the rooms have tubs though so be sure to ask in advance if that is important to you. There is a lovely quiet roof top pool, very good/relaxed cafe and a small but decent gym.
reviews.title: GREAT STAY

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a large room with a comfortable sitting area, though the origianl room had troouble with its air conditioning.....ok it was huge heat wave but the a/c units were struggling. Otherwise great rooms in a great location so close to Santa Monica and Sunset Blvds, with a short wlak to night life, restaurants and supermarket. We walked to the Metro Rapid to get to Santa Monica...no problems. The rooftop plunge pool is small but a great place to escape to during a hot week. A few rough edges but nothing to worry about on a discounted rate. Comparable to an earlier stay at Ramada west Hollywood.
reviews.title: Convenient oasis in Weho

reviews.text: We stayed with our 2 kids and had interconnecting suites - that were huge and stylish. The best thing about this property is the service at the front desk, particularly Eric, who was so helpful in planning in our trip and during our stay. The rooftop pool is lovely, but maybe not the best when travelling with kids due to it being a relatively small area with lots of beautiful people who don't appreciate any child intrusion (even though they were quiet you did get an unwelcome vibe).
reviews.title: Great service and location

reviews.text: Food was great in both the restaurant and room service. Only gripe would be really noisy old airconditioning units.
reviews.title: MY STAY AT THE CHAMBERLAIN

reviews.text: I have stayed at the Chamberlain several times now.
reviews.title: Never again. Outrageously over rated.

reviews.text: i had stayed at the Four Seasons hotel in West Hollywood.
reviews.title: Amazing!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for 3 nights after a road trip of California. Nice spacious rooms with sitting area. Did have a balcony but actually very small and shaded so we didn't use. Loved the rooftop pool, great place for chilling out in the evening. I loved breakfast, nice choices. We ate in the hotel one night, and sat outside in a sunny spot in their little garden terrace, this was really enjoyable. Nice quirky decor, feels high end. And Nobu west hollywood is just around the corner!
reviews.title: loved the rooftop pool

reviews.text: The hotel is on a charming quiet street so you would never have to worry about street noise. The staff is very accommodating making sure everything about your stay is to your liking. The Chamberlain is very clean throughout the entire hotel including the guest rooms. The rooms are large and luxurious, decorated with modern cool furniture. The rooftop pool is peaceful with very comfortable chairs, nice awnings for those who would like shade, and enough chairs in the sun for those who don't. They also offer complementary iced tea and lemonade at the pool which is quite refreshing. I highly recommend staying at The Chamberlain.
reviews.title: Wonderful Stay

reviews.text: I liked this place. The rooms are lovely although the bathrooms are small. The rooftop pool is also small but it has a great view and a really cool bar in the evening. There are a couple of restaurants in walking distance.
reviews.title: Cool place, excellent rooms, nice pool and pool bar

reviews.text: An oasis in the desert of chaos. This was the last leg of our two week vacation- Dana point condo on the strand, Hilton union square san Francisco, the lodge at Sequoia and waiting for an hour on the side of the mountain for construction on the Generals highway we needed a break. We got it at the Chamberlain Hotel in WeHo. From the moment we arrived we were treated like valued and special guests (hard to get that in WeHo!) The lobby, rooms, pool area, restaurant and even the valet area were tastesfully appointed! The room was huge! We highly recommend and wish we could stay longer! In fact our last. Igbt here we just decided to order in and hang out here and we are a family of five
reviews.title: At last-civilization, luxury and conveneince-just what I needed. And people to be extra nice to me.

reviews.text: The hotel is perfectly located, inexpensive and the service is great. We had a great stay with our family and friends and everyone is still talking about how good the hotel was. Thank you Chamberlain we will be back.
reviews.title: Great Hotel Great Location Thank you Chamberlain
Great staff
reviews.text: We stayed @ the Chamberlain for 2 nights in early April. The staff was terrific. The rooms- all suites were newly renovated. There was still lobby renovations going on at the time--so not much to say about it. The pool on the rooftop is never busy - and you can catch some good rays if so desired. We liked the location. The complimentary breakfast was adequate. The pricing also happened to be superb @ $139/night. If you happen to stay here and enjoy sushi ... be sure to hit Katsu-ya (15-20min drive away) w/ ~ 1/2- 1 hour wait all well worth it. Also the Griddle cafe on sunset is great for ridiculous size orders. Enjoy.

reviews.title: Loved the Hotel
reviews.text: What can I say. I usualy don't review places I like. Most of the time I take the time to write a review when I did not get the service I expected. This Hotel was different. Allthough we were told upfront that the hotel is not complete yet, we decided to stay there because of the proximity to Sunset boulevard and the fact that we stayed at other Hotels of the same group before (Viceroy in Palm Springs is awsome!!!). Anyway, the staff was amazing, from the check in staff to the Maids, even the over night secuity person was exraordinary. The rooms are great, newly renovated, great beds, LCD TV's, very spacious. The pooldeck is on the roof with great views. Would love to have some food service on the pool. Restaurant is due to open in May. CAnt wait to try it the next stay.

aka: Chamberlain West Hollywood Hotel West Hollywood
description: Discreetly located on a residential, tree-lined street in West Hollywood amid the exciting Sunset Strip and the bustling Santa Monica Boulevard, our eclectic West Hollywood boutique hotel offers the perfect combination of glamour, comfort and impeccable service. The dramatic style, unique ambiance and convenient location of our West Hollywood accommodations make it an ideal choice for a relaxing extended visit or a short LA getaway for both business and leisure travelers. Step into the glamorous 80s with our avant-garde decor complete with intricate brass detailing, cool hues with rich gold and chocolate accents and a chic retro feel. The Chamberlain West Hollywood boutique hotel features 114 spacious suites, an exclusive chic Bistro, in suite dining plus a stunning rooftop setting with 360-degree panoramic views of the Hollywood hills and elegant spaces for intimate events, private dinners or corporate meetings. Roof top pool offers private cabanas, dining and bar service. Our full service hotel also offers a complimentary 24 hour state of the art fitness center and a 24 hour business center with both MAC and PC's.
